summary: Macrophages can imbibe low-density lipoprotein (LDL) through scavenger receptors to become foam cells. the anti-inflammatory nature of Chinese herbs have the capacity to halt the complex mechanisms underlying atherosclerosis. no specific and effective anti-inflammatory therapy has been described in the literature. herbal medicines are a common form of alternative therapy because of their supposed low toxicity and natural origins. a pharmacologically active component of Salvia miltiorrhiza Bunge (Danshen) reduces atherosclerosis by inhibiting macrophage cholesterol accumulation and proinflammatory cytokine expression. in this study, more than 30 types of anti-inflammatory Chinese herbs were screened. Gentiana scabra dose-dependently suppressed Dii-OxLDL uptake in THP-1 macrophages. the majority of modified lipoproteins are ingested in macrophages through SR-A and CD36. ERK pathway is involved in Gentiana scabra regulating SR-A expression. treatment with an ERK inhibitor, PD98059, reduced the expression of SR-A, but not CD36. the results of this study suggest that Gentiana scabra inhibits OxLDL uptake by regulating SR-A expression. a possible underlying mechanism may be through ERK signaling pathways. SRs (SR-A and CD36) are responsible for the internalization of OxLDL. the uptake of cholesterol-rich LDL by macrophages is believed to be critical in mediating the development of atherosclerotic plaques. current study revealed Gentiana scabra reduced OxLDL uptake significantly in THP-1 macrophages. but some limitations should be noted before the findings are interpreted. atherosclerosis is a chronic inflammatory disease with a complex interplay of various cell types, such as endothelial cells (ECs), vascular smooth muscle cells (VSMCs) and macrophages in vessel walls. the so-called “Junn-Chenn-Zuou-SS” theory illustrates a concept of coordinated effects from a combination of compounds or Chinese herbs. a combination of compounds or Chinese herbs might make Chinese herbs less toxic and more highly tolerated than Western drugs.
